Reviews.Title: “false advertising on website”
Reviews.Author: neveragainGeorgia
Reviews.Content: oh my gosh where do i start.first of all the website said restuarant and lounge and wifi in rooms.well when we got there the restuarnat had been closed down for good.and no wifi in rooms..lots of people hanging around in lobby with there laptops every single night and day.shaddy looking people hanging around inside and outside.no security.then the elevators were on there last leg and the floors in the hallways were sooo nasty..stains everywhere and dirt.get to the room,was happy with size then the smell was alittle weird.then looked in bathroom and the tub had been sprayed with paint and the paint was peeling off so could not take a bath and mold all around tub.safe did not work..asked for manager and he was no where around.went out the back stairwell and oh my .trash everywhere.but worst thing was i got the managers number and called him and told him about the place and false advertising and he was so rude he didnt offer us anything and hung up on me.so i went over his head..so there you have it enter at your own risk

Reviews.Title: “Oy Vey”
Reviews.Author: anhellica1979
Reviews.Content: I was here for a reception/party, did not stay in an actual room. Immediately upon entering the lobby, though clean, I was assaulted by a strong smell I couldn't quite place...very overpowering and off-putting. The facility was old and in need of an update. The carpet was FILTHY; they actually started to vaccuum after the guests had started arriving!!! The bathrooms had no soap or paper to dry your hands. We had to pass around our own hand sanitizer. There was a "medical" issue with an apparent regular (and shady) guest in the front hallway as the guests were arriving - if that wasn't a sign to turn around and leave, I don't know what was. On the plus side, the staff was friendly, accomodating and helpful. The location is right on the corner of a main road, so I'm sure it's a great location for tourists passing through or wanting to move around Kissimmee. I just couldn't believe how much they paid for this salon compared to the awful quality. I couldn't imagine what the rooms are like. Ick.

Reviews.Title: “A Dump w/Good Personnel”
Reviews.Author: tderk
Reviews.Content: This is a motel that is in desparate need of a complete rehab. Everything, and I mean everything, needs replacement and upgrading. I experienced filthy carpets, lumpy mattresses, broken outdated furnishings, as well as a lack of a proper computer work area. There was no dead bolt lock on the door which, to me, should be mandated by law. The worst offense was cockroaches, which I found in two places. During the night was when they chose to have workmen hammering, sawing, and ripping molding off walls in the hallway, something which should have been done during the day when customers are not trying to sleep. Also, the morning I was leaving I was subjected to a shower that had no hot water (caused, I was told, by a valve malfunction in the building). On the good side, the staff was most helpful. I had made it clear when I checked in that a good internet connection was an absolute necessity. When I could not get a good connection in the room I was given, I was moved to a more expensive room (at no additional cost) that was next to the motels wireless router which assured me an excellent connection. They also gave me personalized assistance in establishing a connection to the motels wireless network. Personally, I would never stay here again unless it is totally rebuilt. My desperate needs at the time was the only reason I stayed this time.

Reviews.Title: “Yep, America's WORST”
Reviews.Author: 321AreaFemale
Reviews.Content: My room was fine. Everything worked ok. They charge you an extra $5 for a microwave and another $5 for a small refrigerator. Everything looks ok during the day.....until the sun goes down. Then it's party time for all the bugs INCLUDING cockroaches! As soon as I saw one, I packed up and I LEFT at 1 a.m.! I shook all my clothes out in my garage when I got home to make sure none of them were in my luggage. The building attached which is 10 stories high, has been shut down. So dont think you can get a floor above the 4th floor in the main building. I'm attaching photos I took.

Reviews.Title: “AMERICAS BEST? MORE LIKE THE WORST OF THE WORST!”
Reviews.Author: MoMoGrace
Reviews.Content: This place was the hotel from hell! It was disgusting. The walls were rotting at the floor boards, the were holes in the wash cloths looked like 1000 moths took over them. There were holes in the curtains, the carpets were wet from the A/C which is what rotted the walls, and it had mold in the walls. The furniture was broke. The rooms SMELLED! we couldnt even get a key for the room because their machine broke. The box springs were so old and nasty they were rusting through. When you held up the comforters all the guts fell to the bottom of them. I cannot express how nasty this place was. The neighborhood is like GHETTO CENTRAL, someone got into a fight in the parking lot at like 3 in the morning. There is a lounge that all the surrounding hotel guest wander into and get hammered to leave and make as much noise as possible on their way out. The workers cussed up a storm as we were going in at one point, and when i said something they got rude with us. The General Manager is an utter jerk off. He still will not refund us for the night from hell! PLEASE FOR THE LOVE OF ALL THAT IS HOLY DO NOT TAKE YOUR FAMILY HERE! I WOULDNT LET MY DOG SLEEP IN THIS CRAP HOLE!

Reviews.Title: “wont stay there again!!”
Reviews.Author: brussell143
Reviews.Content: Cheap kids suite for a reason. No fridge, microwave, or kids tv as promised. Maintenance did bring us a fridge and microwave when we complained but never did bring the kids tv. Bathroom shower painted over and paint was peeling, tiles coming off wall, bloodstains in toilet really grossed us out. Not enough towels or pillows. Door on entertainment center broken and hanging off hinges, fell off on my foot. Heater did not work at all.Beds VERY uncomfortable, and old. One staff member dancing, gawking at my fiance, and making rude comments towards her in the lobby. Hot tub was cold. About the only good thing was the front desk staff was very nice and friendly. Other than that, very very bad stay and will not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “WASTE OF MONEY”
Reviews.Author: machy4973
Reviews.Content: i think is a lot better to stay on the street than pay for this hotel, the 2 nights we pay for, we end staying only 1 day, fleas "i don't own a pet", noises, the security guard is like 75 years old, the maintenance guy, smell like marihuana and drunk, he said he is working at this hotel for 4 years. we call for service because our a/c was not working at 9:15 pm. the guy show up at 10:30 pm, with his wife or so. the towels look like they been used, they smell like swet. you can smell the mold, on the bathroom, the safe no key, the tv, no, on or off switch. the iron look like they iron the asphalt. the iron board has burn marks. carpet smell like puke, people fighting, the manager, ahhh the manager, is the worst of the worst, he look like contruction chief, he did not give us back the money of the second day, that we end up leaving after the first night before 1 pm why 1 pm, no a/c we did not sleep till 9 am thats when they change the a/c. the front desk at night, was awesome, the only good about this hotel... no coffee, no gym, the sliding door no open, the a/c after they change it, was making noises like a turbine from an airplane, by 3 am, the a/c stop cooling, call the front the desk and it was another guy and he said he can do nothing till 8 am. 8:15 the same drunk guy, show up with another a/c unit. ahh the internet, there is not internet, no signal at all, had to go to the lobby, and the a/c there was not working neither, they has a big fan, the ice machines on my floor don't work, the picture they have of a big bulding is a lie, has been on remodelation since 2004. the door at the end of the corridor on the 4th floor was open leading me to a ghost building, me and my wife went in and found the stairs, we went all the way to the end, "no remember how many floors, i think 10" nice view by the way. this hotel and the management are the worst of the worst. now they paint the big empty building, comon if you or any one that you know going for this hotel ask for a discount of 100%, they should pay you for staying at this garbage. this is not americas best inn, this is americas worst nightmare inn. thank you for not staying!

Reviews.Title: “Did I stay at a different hotel to the bad reviewers?”
Reviews.Author: Kwaitang
Reviews.Content: Stayed here just for 1 night as passing through Kissimmee. Since returning home I read the bad reviews from other people and can't beleive it was the same hotel I stayed at. This is a budget hotel so I didn't expect the Ritz. I was however pleasantly surprised. As soon as I walked in to the hotel I could smell the polish. The reception area was spotless, fresh and clean.(so different from an Econolodge we had just left, where the smell of curry made your eyes water) I remarked on this to the manager who said that he had taken over recently and had put a lot of hard work into the place and it showed. Our room was clean, functional and comfortable. Our bedding and towels were clean and no, I didn't fall out of the bed as one of the previous contributers seemed to. Admittedly, the balconies are small but we both sat on the 2 chairs provided overlooking the pool. During the evening I did see a security guard patroling, did not see any undesirables hanging round the place, so felt perfectly safe. In the morning staff were out cleaning the pool and grounds. All in all, a very good stay. I would certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “condem this hotel and fire managment”
Reviews.Author: pancho11
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? No service, no internet that works,no towels by the pool(you must bring your own),the towels in the rooms are old and stained,no coffee or coffee cups in rooms,lot's of shady people living in the hotel(hold on to your wallets,the ouside grounds are dirty and gangbanger types hanging out in front of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money!”
Reviews.Author: Whltravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here whilst travelling round america for two months. Got a cheap weekly rate and it was good for the money. We had a problem with the a/c and someone was round to look at it within 10 minutes and it was fixed. Staff on the front desk were very helpful when i was looking for a phone card. Its not the ritz's but for the money its ideal. It has a good location with shops and resturants in walking distance and a great English pub up the road. Also close to all the parks and Old Town.

Reviews.Title: “cheap stay”
Reviews.Author: EdwardGomeznfamily
Reviews.Content: was a cheap stay, get what you pay for goes along way with words. crappy wi fi service, no breakfast but clean and close to disney easy to gate 15 min ride lots of things to do near by also. to add we did feel safe

Reviews.Title: “Don't Bother”
Reviews.Author: FUNMOMENTS
Reviews.Content: the beds were uncomfortable (my mom went with us and she kept falling off hers), the quilts didn't stay on while we slept and they were obviously cheap. the lock box in our room did not have a key. the power button on the tv wasn't even there. the balcony couldn't fit more than one person, people went out on a belcony just below ours that was bigger (i don't think it was off a room but somewhere you could go) and kept being loud and obnoxious making hard to sleep at all. the showers were hard to figure out and the faucet themselves were loose and you can see where soap was left over from previous guests in the shower. I've been in cheap places, but they need to tear this one down and start over. don't waste your money

Reviews.Title: “For the money, an OK place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: Ampmobiles
Reviews.Content: We looked and looked on-line for a place to stay during our business trip to Orlando. Not knowing the area we were unsure of booking ahead of time so we took our chances. Seeing the rate on the sign outside we stopped in! Sure the place is a little run down, but was decent. The staff was quite friendly to us and they even gave us a great suite with bunkbeds for the grandchildren traveling with us - all for the same low price. The bathtub needed work (dripped and needed to be repaired) and the microwave should be replaced. Other than that our room was just fine. Two TVs (one in our section with queen bed and one in double/single bunkbed section), microwave and mini-frig, table and chairs, bench at door, separate sink outside of bathroom area (sink also inside bathroom area), clothes hanging rack, coffee pot with coffee, cream, etc. lots of drawers (we were staying for 4 nights so clothes were put out of the way), quite roomy area throughout. Much larger than we were expecting to get for the money. There is a large pool, a kiddie wading pool, playground (one piece needed repair but the rest was useable by all of the children), basketball goal (we had brought our own basketball but some were available at the desk), vollyball and shuffleboard (needed cleaning off from oak trees surrounding area) and a nice putting green (9 holes spread around) with clubs and balls at the desk. The grandchildren had a grand time for the days we stayed and slept great. Again, for the money a good deal, unless you need fancy trappings and plush carpet. Part of the place was closed down, but in this ecomony I can understand why! Housekeeping did the best they could to keep the halls and lobby clean. I would recommend looking at our room before checking in to know what you are getting, some rooms must be pretty bad judging by other reviews. Ours was fine. As for price, other hotels advertise the same or less per night, just be sure you are not going to charged for additional persons with the price. We were charged the advertised price for all in our party - two adults and three children - no extra as some of the others wanted to charge. One other thing, there are a few places to eat within walking distance, but most are more of a short drive away. They also do offer bus service to the parks and such and have a small "store" inside the lobby. No restaurant on site, but Perkins is just across the street. Remember, this is NOT a fancy place (it was at one time) but for our money a good deal!

Reviews.Title: “Never never never stay at this nasty nasty hotel from hell!”
Reviews.Author: TaterDan
Reviews.Content: This by far was the WORST AND UNCLEAN motel I've ever encountered. Where to begin on a worst stay ever at a hotel....First, the carpet looked like a murder scene happened with blood EVERYWHERE!! We asked for a frig and microwave...and guess what...there WAS NOT ONE in the room! Next, I cut my hand on the shabby sliding glass doors. Then, the headboard came apart from the wall and almost fell on my kid. It was a very bad experience. Lots of sticky stuff visible on the linens, the shower was completely GROSS! The telephone in the room was in 3 pieces in the floor. Also, the pool they claimed was HEATED, WELL GUESS WHAT....IT WAS NOT HEATED...VERY VERY COLD!!!!!!!!There were a ton of bloody cats in the parking lot begging for food and hissing at us!! Beware, they stay under your cars!!!!! There are not enough terrible words to describe this hotel and experience. DO YOURSELF A BIG FAVOR AND DON'T RELY ON INTERNET PICTURES, BECAUSE IN THIS CASE, THEY DO LIE!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dollkisses
Reviews.Content: We happened to get one of the good rooms. We had room service come two times a week. We only had two problems for the whole two week stay (TV going out & air conditioner not working), but the maintenance guy was very good at his job and got the jobs done in minutes. Our room was clean from the minute we stepped in, but we had to use a little room spritz to get rid of the smoky smell. The service was amazing. All the people who worked there were super nice and did everything they could to make our stay great. The location is perfect for vacationers who want to stay there for a little - there's a Wal*Mart within a 20 minute walk. Good work-out. There's also a Perkin's restaurant with nice employees. The price was excellent! The beds are average, a little hard, but better than most hotels I've been to. Overall, this hotel was amazing, and the next time I go to Kissimmee, I will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Very”
Reviews.Author: DeeD7
Reviews.Content: Very comfortible, relaxing, enjoyed the entire time was there.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away - terrible place”
Reviews.Author: Eli_Picaso
Reviews.Content: After 4 night I couldn't find any good thing in this hotel. Save your money for better one

Reviews.Title: “Best to Stay Clear”
Reviews.Author: Tiredtravel
Reviews.Content: Cough up that change and stay at a better property or you might be in for one hell of a family vacation listening to your wife complain about the dingy rooms. Nasty beds....Foul odor. Go see mickey...you'll walk out with empty pockets but a nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Spots should be changed to Fungus Spots”
Reviews.Author: FloridaDeby
Reviews.Content: Bathroom sink was in mid-air and unusable. Live wasp nest in the sliding door. We took the bunk bed room for the children, TV's didn't work and mattresses were long overdue for replacement. Spa was not looking safe to use. The hotel did not offer all they had on their listing. We could smell smoke coming from Non-Smoking rooms. Hidden charges for use of the Safe appeared on my credit card....we decided to make the best of a bad situation but calling it "Fun Spots" is a real joke. The kids thought it was going to be "fun".

Reviews.Title: “PLAIN NASTY”
Reviews.Author: ej046j
Reviews.Content: ,We got there,, lobby looked ok but then looks can be deceiving,, national lampoons vacations pool looked aheck of lots better than what was aval,the rooms PHEWYYYYY we decided to clean up what should of done years ago and with the new renovation going on they should just condem the place ive had my say thankyou

Reviews.Title: “OMG!”
Reviews.Author: beersz
Reviews.Content: Please. DO NOT STAY!! Price says it all! Looks great on "pictures". I have to agrre with most of others said. Ceiling, (plaster), was peeling, ready to fall. Mould, holy geez, LOT'S. Could not take a bath. Shower only. Stay away no matter what the price! NEVER AGAIN!

Reviews.Title: “STAY AWAY!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelinmom77
Reviews.Content: The absolute worst! I cannot believe the Board of Health keeps this pace open. My family went for one night (live in-state) and saw four rooms, each one worse than the one before: mold on the walls, screwdriver marks on the walls, broken sliding glass doors, missing lightbulbs, rickety old furniture, hallways smelled like animal urine. Unfortunately we pre-paid so we were stuck, but a week later, I still feel itchy and nauseous just thinking about this place. There are other budget hotels on Rte. 192 that are much better quality! STAY AWAY!!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel i have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: lezzers
Reviews.Content: i am appaled at the advice written by recent visitors. i have been staying at this hotel since 1993 i always get a good deal and always get very well looked after. the rooms are cleaned everyday and also bedding is changed everyday. love this hotel with a passion and can not understand if things have gone terribly wrong i am planning on going back next year and would definatly stay there again. the customer service is 1st class quality, if u need a lovely room and a nice hotel then this is the one we stayed in the 1st refurbished room and it was lovely

Reviews.Title: “Please dont ever go their trust the reviews or you will regret your stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ddavis2002
Reviews.Content: Well me and my boyfriend stayed here from April 13th-19th and after I booked the hotel is when I read the horrible ratings which was to late so I was nervous the whole time before going to Florida and when I got their. When we checked in the lobby was very nice looking and the pics on the wall of the rooms didnt look so bad but when we got to the room what a shocking situation I wanted to go back home the head board was hanging off the wall the floor was horrible and the the remote to the tv didnt work and the power button was missing. Next I went to the bathroom and the toilet and shower was nasty so we immediately went to walmart down the street and bought carpet freshener and bleach, disinfected spray because we knew that we was gonna be their for a week. It gets worse next morning woke up To a roach in the bathroom crawling on the wall, we got spray so then the room smelled like roach spray and dog urine. The next day we woke up to the ceiling in the bathroom leaking over the toilet so my boyfriend was very upset they showed us several other rooms but they were worst then the one I had we had no time to deal wit situation due to us going to dworld but when we got back the toilet wasnt leaking and I was very happy because I think the room we had was one of the better ones and I had already cleaned the room to where it was half way comfortable, we stayed out till 3am and and got up at 630 and slept with towels on the pillows and my hoodie on wore flip flops in the shower..... Its so much more but I recommend not even a animal to stay here read the ratings I did after the fact that I already paid for the package deal, never again will I do the package deal with travelocity. I spent my birthday very uncomfortable, they need to really update this hotel it could be nice, one more thing DONT USE THEIR PHONE THEY BLOCKED OUR CARD TO GET IN THE ROOM DUE TO HAVING A 26.00 CHARGE FROM THE PHONE STATED THEY NEEDED TO GET OUR ATTENTION BY LOCKING US OUT THE ROOM WITH OUR STUFF IN THE ROOM, OF COURSE I DIDNT PAY DUE TO ALL THE TROUBLE THEY PUT US THROUGH THE STAFF WAS NICE EXPECT THE BLACK GUY WHO WORKED NIGHTS MY BOYFRIEND WANTED TO BEAT HIM UP but DONT STAY HERE..........

Reviews.Title: “The fun spot hotel”
Reviews.Author: barbara390
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in need of repairs. It is good for bums or for travelers without children if you will only be there to sleep, but I would not want to hang around there on a vacation. Mattresses and beds are at the end of its life so if you are picky about your bed, do not stay at the Fun Spot. My family and I stayed there for a week and 2 out of 7 days the maid came to clean our rooms and put new towels, toilet paper in. After that we were on our own. I booked two rooms and will never stay there again. There were people that were doing drugs and smoking funny stuff. There were underwear outside the back sliding door. The pool and hot tub is nasty.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away!”
Reviews.Author: TinkerBell0973
Reviews.Content: All I can say is stay away! We stayed here for 5 days, the longest 5 days of our lives! First room we got was just nasty! Big stains in carpet, bathtub had a major dry dirt build up in the bottom of it, the floor in there felt like it had major sunblock all over it, you could ice skate across the floor, second room offered the bathtub would not shut off, third room was ok so we took it. Guy next door would fight every night with someone in his room, also had a large dog that barked for 5 days straight! Cats roaming the property. Had a party going on in the reception room that started sometime before 9pm and was still going full swing at 2:30 am when we had to check out to get to the airport! All I can say is trust the reviews! Also would like to add if you calue your health stay away from the ice machines! We had seen inside the one on first floor when it was being worked on for an ice jam and the white plastic gaurd inside the machine was nothing but black from MOLD!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty rooms, vacumn must not touch the floors and room smelled”
Reviews.Author: OneHippyChick
Reviews.Content: Thats about all you need to know. Terrible will never go back. You must be careful of the hotels on Irlo Bronson as many in the cheap range are run down and dirty. I was there only to sleep that night and when daylight came and I could see...well I ran.

Reviews.Title: “Great value...worth every cent!”
Reviews.Author: David52601
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Fun Spots Feb. 15-22, 2009. It is not a new facility, but economical, decent, clean, friendly and conveniently located. I will absolutely stay at Fun Spots again. David Otto, Burlington, Iowa.

Reviews.Title: “gone down hill!!!!!!! BIG TIME!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lisamc2205
Reviews.Content: we have stayed at this hotel loads before, but as a family of 6 have to say that this was by far the worst!!!! when we started coming here it was a great friendly family hotel. but 6 yrs ago when the hurricane tore down half the 7000 building it started to go downhill we stayed again 2 yrs later as it was Gd value for money (2 years ago) but they still after 2 years after had not done anything with the 7000 building and the room standards had dropped quite a bit but when we booked to come this year we thought they have now had 6 yrs to rectify the 7000 building. but no it was still derelict!! also the rooms had really suffered attention!! we had loud air conditioning wallpaper coming off dirty bathroom, and when we used to come it was free coffee in the rooms, now you have to buy it from the machine downstairs in the lobby!!! the balcony bar felt unsafe as it wobbled when u touched it, with a 4 year old in the room this was a big concern!!! we where really disappointed with this visit and rest assured will never be going there again!!!! i would like to advise all people never to stay here it is unsafe unclean and unhelpful staff. this hotel should be shut down!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Spot ? Maybe not.”
Reviews.Author: DGD352
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel several years ago when it was called the Ramada Fountain Park. This time we were ''walk ins'' when we saw the sign outside stating weekly rates at $149. Still had the smell of tobacco in the corridors that was there years earlier even though it is now a no smoking hotel. Staff friendly and helpful, though we were there for 6 days before we had any maidservice. Needed to track down a toilet roll after day 4. The hotel now appears to be a community home for locals who have lost their own homes for whatever reason. School buses pick up and deposit school kids who are living in the 'hotel' on a daily basis. The same kids use the hotel facilities. Lots of the balconies have signs of habitation, such as BBQ's and bicycles. There was one incident where a 'guest' was dressed in towels and on various occasions over a 24 hour period could be seen and heard shouting and yelling from his balcony, obscenities and general abuse. He was either drunk or on drugs or both. He was subsequently taken away by the police after a night where I was awoken at 12.30am, 2.30am and 7.15am. One English holidaymaker and her family who travelled with Cosmos were quite annoyed as they had been told that the hotel was three star but it is patently obvious this is not the case. No entertainment, no restaurant. On one occasion there was loud music blasting around the pool area when there was absolutely nobody there apart from my wife and I and when asked if it could be turned off or down we were told that it was on a timer and could not be controlled as nobody had the key to the bar where the controls were located. We left the pool as it was impossible to relax because of the noise, but in fairness from that day there was no music around the pool. If you like Kissimmee the hotel is in a good location as it is not too far from the attractions and there is a Perkins restaurant right next door, with many other restaurants within a short drive. If you don't mind staying with the locals then you won't have a problem staying at this hotel. You get what you pay for I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Not that bad”
Reviews.Author: DavyPick
Reviews.Content: We stayed in august 2008. Read some bad reviews,but overall it wasnt as bad as some people said. There was some work going on there and one block was shut completely. That didnt bother us coz it meant that the pool was empty most of the time. The staff were friendly enough,but the guy on the Disney ticket desk was a bit of a nuisance for a couple of days. He tried to sell me tickets for a knockdown price and then said i had to go somewhere else to pick them up after I attended a meeting to sell me a hoilday at another hotel. So we didnt bother. Got them in the Wall mart. All in all it was ok. But I wouldnt like to stay there when it is fully open,because the pool is not big enough for the amount of rooms. Better off in a smaller motel . The place was clean enough. Apart from the leaking bath tap,which poured water out constantly.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room, Horrible Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: Garciamaddiegene
Reviews.Content: The room itself was overall clean, however the bathroom was disgusting. We checked in at around 10pm and either the staff didnt know how to do their jobs or they just didnt care. The surface of the bathroom was clean but the water coming out of the pipes smelled and felt dirty. Then to make things worse when I went into the bathroom late at night I found little bugs crawling around on the floor. I would only recommend this hotel if you have no use for the bathroom otherwise pay the extra money to stay some place else, I wish I had.

Reviews.Title: “Beware!!! Run for your life!!!”
Reviews.Author: ledwardsga
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be condemned!! There was mold growing on the floor in the corners and in the attraction books. The rooms were damp and musty, room's weren't clean, doors wouldn't close, the funiture was torn up, what appeared to be blood stains on the box springs. They moved us to 3 differents rooms the one room that was descent it still had issues. We stuck it out 1 night out of 4 to find another hotel. We slept in our clothes didn't shower, well there was no hot water if we wanted to! They said that there were remolded rooms, the only remodeling was they painted and changed the bedspread. This place was the pits All can say is Run from this no Fun Spot!!!! The American and Hispanic Staff was nice but that was it! After this experience we will never use priceline again.

Reviews.Title: “Not too good!”
Reviews.Author: Monkeys2
Reviews.Content: I received my stay at this hotel "free" for touring a timeshare. Otherwise, I certainly would not have paid for it. As soon as you walk in there is a musky/moldy smell. Upon entering the room we found that there was no refridgerator/microwave. I asked the front desk and they said you have to rent these for $5 each!!! When you laid on the beds, you could feel every spring in the mattress. In the bathroom the cover for the light switch was missing. My small children could not take baths because the bathtub stopper did not work. I was somewhat afraid to walk on the carpet in my bare feet. The power button on the tv was missing, so you had to put your finger in a hole on the front of the tv to turn it on and once you did it barely picked up. Also, you must pay for coffee from a machine set up in the front lobby and yes, you will repeatedly be asked if you are interested in theme park tickets. There is a family of wild cats/kittens living in the parking lot of this hotel. Luckily, we were only in our hotel room long enough to sleep/shower. I advise you to upgrade!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worst than a nightmare!”
Reviews.Author: Rufinita
Reviews.Content: After reading many reviews and spending less than an hour in such place , it's a shame that some traveling services continue to include this "hotel" in their offers. The place isn't safe, the sinks have leaks, it's dirty! The rooms are dark and the carpets old and have bad odors. This place should be closed.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad on a budget.”
Reviews.Author: disneyheidi
Reviews.Content: Finding the place was a little difficult, as it used to be a Ramada and the big "Ramada" sign is blacked out with a much smaller sign underneath that said "Fountain Park" in red lights. It was partially obstructed and we drove by twice before we found it. Once we got there we were greeted by a very friendly man and we checked into our room. I read on these reviews that the staff will relentlessly try to sell theme park tickets. We only had this offerd to us once in the 4 nights we stayed here. We said "no thank you" and we were't bothered again. The room was clean. No problems with leaky faucets or dirty tubs as others have noted. There was a rip in the box spring mattress. We had a nice balcony overlooking the pool. We spent little time at the hotel because we stayed in the parks for most of our waking hours. We didn't use the pool but it looked very nice and there was a hot tub as well. We didn't try the restaurant either so I can't comment on that. It was very close to all the Disney parks and getting back and forth was conveinent. It was also very close to the outlet stores and wal-mart.

Reviews.Title: “Reviews here are accurate - it's terrible.”
Reviews.Author: msb3547
Reviews.Content: I can't believe Skyauction continues to be affiliated with this hotel. The reviews are right on the mark. Paid for 3 nights and left after one night. Terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Tired but clean.”
Reviews.Author: Lizzie34
Reviews.Content: We originally booked to go to Greece with Kosmar, but they cancelled 6 days before we were due to go (nightmare, but that's another story!), so we had to find something quickly and in the same price range. Me and hubby had been to Florida 16 years ago, pre-kids, so managed to find a short notice weeks holiday there through a travel agent. We trusted the brochures word for it and didn't bother looking up reviews (which we normally do!) Kids (girl 14 and boy 11) were really looking forward to it, we were a bit disappointed with it all for a day or two, but were soon busy out and about so it didn't spoil our holiday. So... outside looked grubby, reception was marble, ceiling fans, sofas etc, so thought mmm looks ok. Checked in, staff very friendly, got lift to our 3rd floor room (lifts a bit tempremental). Very first impression was old and tired, peeling paint, TV on/off button broken and disappeared inside the TV!, bathroom door hinges rusty, fittings coming off the walls, taps loose, etc. On the plus side, the toilet flushed, the shower worked and there was plenty of hot water, the a/c worked fine, the beds were comfy (although extra pillows would've been nice) and we had a balcony overlooking the pool (although we didn't have chairs and most other rooms did). The room was very clean and the housekeeping staff were great, clean towels, beds made and floor hoovered every day. We soon realised that there were no tea/coffee making facilities as described in the brochure and when I mentioned this to the manager, he apologised and said they don't do that anymore, but I could get a cup of hot water from the drinks maker in the reception for 75c and he would give me a teabag! I think it depends on which room you have, because I've read in other reviews that people have had fridges and microwaves in their rooms! There was a hairdryer and iron, but I ended up going out to buy a kettle and extra pillow! Around the hotel - didn't bother with the restaurant (only open for breakfast) or the bar. Games room wasn't up to much and the 'gym' had a treadmill (broken) and a crosstrainer. The pool was good, looked clean and not too much chlorine, clean towels for you to use were put out every day. Also a jaccuzi (although not sure how this was cleaned, and quite a few bodies are in there throughout the day!) There was never more than a few people at the pool at one time, and it closed at 11pm (to be honest I would say that the pool was the best thing about this hotel!) At the back of the pool is a small kids play area (also a very strong smell of gas), then round to the left is a lovely lake with swinging bench seats. Couple of warnings - scammers push pizza flyers under the hotel doors , do not order from these people! Also, the ticket sellers in reception can be quite pushy and try to persuade you into timeshare. We bought our tickets - Seaworld, Universal, Gaterland and Wet n Wild - from Walmart, got a good saving and a safe place to buy. By the way, Walmart is excellent for anything you want to buy and it's open 24 hours! Good places to eat are Perkins (just over the road), staff great and good food, and Sizzlin Grill ($3.49 all you can eat breakfast!) if you don't mind plastic plates. All in all an old but clean hotel (just use as a base to sleep and change), and in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN...Checked out EARLY!”
Reviews.Author: NLDisneyfans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (in our mid 30's) travel from Canada to the Orlando area frequently, this time booking a 5 night stay here at the Ramada Eastgate. YIKES!!! The outside and lobby are deceiving, they look reasonable...just wait until you get to your room!!! For starters trying to get up to our room on the 4th floor, 1 of the 2 elevators were broken and 2nd one didn't sound too safe! At a first glance upon entering the room it appeared to be "adequate". Our room did have a microwave and mini-fridge, thank goodness because the restaurant downstairs was shut down for business (not sure why), so we had to go to a local 7-eleven to buy food. Our UNpleasant stay started while waiting to check-in, the guy at the guest relations counter on the side of the front desk started HOUNDING us to take a "resort tour" in exchange for discount attraction tix or a rebate of $100...We already had our Disney tix and he just would not leave us alone, one day he even followed me into the elevator, a bit much...BEWARE of this SCAM!!!!! It wouldn't be so bad if these guys would just take a simple "no" for an answer! As for the room, believe what you are reading here, paint off the walls, a constant running bath tub and rusty disgusting drains that backed up and had no plugs. The bath tub was painted and paint was peeling from that as well. Everything was very old (carpet, furniture)The king size bed was super old and was sunk down on both sides from over use, very uncomfortable, sheets did appear clean (I would not have gotten in them otherwise) however only 3 pillows that were flat, had to use towels under the pillows to make a little more comfortable. A very strong musty/moldy smell to the entire room at all times. Went down by the pool one time only, my husband got in the pool while I sunbathed. We couldn't tolerate anymore than 1 hour due to the strong sulfur/sewer smell around the whole pool area, it was making me sick. Upon our 4th morning there at 7am I awoke to the biggest roach I ever saw crawling up the wall on my husbands side of the bed, I could not believe my eyes. I call the front desk for IMMEDIATE assistance. 15 minutes later, I had to call down again and I was told someone was on their way. For 20 minutes I waited in the hallway with the door open while my husband watched this thing crawl all over our room to make sure he didn't get in our suitcases! UGH! Maintenance did remove the roach and totally tried to down play the whole incident as if it wasn't a big deal! Sorry, it was a VERY BIG DEAL to us. Even though we were suppose to be there another night, we packed our bags immediately and checked out an hour later. There is only so much anyone can tolerate, I had had enough by that point! We found the whole area to be full of these hounding "Resort tour" scam artists that was very much a big annoyance to our stay. WE DIDN'T WANT to buy any darn Timeshares!!!!!!!!! We gladly left this hotel/area and found a great CLEAN hotel over on International drive for $70/night with a great FREE breakfast. I guess we all live and learn!!! We will NEVER stay at the Ramada eastgate again. Feel free to email me if you would like to know anything further regarding this resort. My advice will ultimately be STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “Not Such a "Fun Spot" But At Least It Was Clean”
Reviews.Author: tawnhet
Reviews.Content: The hotel on the outside, as well as the lobby, was nice. The room, however, is another story. Although clean and air conditioned, the paint was peeling from the ceiling and walls, beds were very uncomfortable, shower had a small stream of water that ran constantly, thus rusting the tub, and the bathroom smelled hideous. Room service was good, and linens and towels and room cleaned each day by housekeeping. Not much on TV--no cable. The one thing that really irked me was when I went to get some info on a nearby excursion, and the gentleman staffing the info desk insisted on signing me up for "$100 free for just looking at a resort," and pestered me about it. I don't appreciate trying to be suckered into a scam while on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is the worst we have stayed in Orlando of about 30-35 hotels!”
Reviews.Author: toinab21
Reviews.Content: We are Disney passholders who spend about 20-25 nights a year in Orlando. We usually priceline a 2.5 or 3 star. My wife was tired and mistakenly selected a 2 star property. We paid $30 a night for two nights. The property is located at the SE corner of Poinciana and 192 but you would not notice it by the signage. There is a Ramada sign but nothing indicating "Fun Spots" anywhere. I asked the manager why and she said there is usually a marquee that runs a crawl with "Fun Spots" on it but that it was not functioning. They didn't try to resort fee us. We stayed in room 4517. It was clean but really worn. Stained carpet, walls, etc...We disinfected it pretty well and decide we would stick it out. We essentially use our rooms for sleeping and getting ready for theme parks. Our room was quiet. There was no coffee maker but there was a hair dryer and iron. We called down for towels twice on Sat. but no one ever came. When we came back Sat. night there were two Osceola County squad cars in front??? On Sunday morning the handle fell off the sink in the bathroom. We called down at 7:10AM and no one had come to fix by checkout at 10:15AM. We just laughed it off and our kids won't remember what a dump this place was. I would avoid 2 star, Disneyworld area on Priceline for awhile!

Reviews.Title: “Believe What You Have Read About This one, It's Bad!!”
Reviews.Author: Pete581
Reviews.Content: This hotel reminds me of one of those seen after Hurricane Katrina. Defiantly a disaster site. Believe what you have read about this hotel! It Is Bad!!! There is not enough space to document all the problems but, here are just a few, carpets with stains from who know what, the smell of urine, mold, and mildew (these are the ones I can describe). Paint peeling off walls and ceramic tiles missing or broken (not just cracked). If this is what the Ramada Corp allows to be included in there chain, then I will stop using their hotels and encourage others to do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible. And it exploits a Priceline vulnerability to pull people in”
Reviews.Author: ploughman8
Reviews.Content: This hotel garnered a long string of bad Trip Advisor reviews as the Ramada Hotel Eastgate. It's back with a new name and maybe new owners (though it still had the Ramada sign when I was there). Other than that, the decline continues. The best thing I can say is that I only had to stay one night. The place was probably OK and at the middle to upper middle of the market in the 70s, but now it's about 10 years past due for renovations. My room had the musty and mildewy smell noticed by others. The carpet, beds, all furniture and fixtures were tired and overworn. In the bathroom, the toilet tank lid had been replaced with a non-fitting one, there was a foul smell, paint was cracking and signs abounded that maintenance was merely trying to keep things operational. I had been put here through Priceline after bidding 2-star and up in Kissimmee and other Orlando zones. At $22 (for a weeknight in mid-January), it hit on this place. With taxes and the hidden Priceline service charge the total came to $31.88. Ah, but then they surprise all Priceline and other customers on check-in with a RESORT FEE of $3.34 a night (they say it's $2.95, but that amount is subject to hotel/motel tax, so it's really $3.34). A 2-star (should be sub 1-star) place that charges a resort fee! Supposedly this is for a shuttle to Disney, use of exercise equipment and some other things that should be part of the base rate. What the fee really does is allow this place to unfairly bag a lot of unsuspecting customers like myself through Priceline at the expense of better, less underhanded competitors in one of the country's most crowded and competitive hotel areas. I'm pretty sure, for example, that other hotels would have taken a bid at $25.34 (22 + 3.34), probably even in the same zone (Kissimmee /Disney is glutted with budget hotels). But those other hotels were probably under the illusion that you can play it straight and still get customers via Priceline. Of course, Priceline has a blanket disclaimer saying that you may run into resort fees and, if you do, they're your responsibility. Sorry, guys...you have a quality problem here and you need to take ownership of that problem. When people get dumped into lousy hotels that shouldn't even BE on Priceline because the hotel management used hidden fees so that they could accept bids at lower bid levels than competitors and "scoop up" the bids, those customers will justifiably feel abused. They will hold the hotel AND Priceline responsible and give bad word-of-mouth to the hotel AND Priceline. Playing CYA with disclaimers won't save you in the court of public opinion. Lesson learned: I won't be bidding through Priceline for Orlando again. The only other defense, if you MUST use Priceline, is to not bid lower than 2.5-stars for Kissimmee. This hotel was likely built anticipating a boom from Disney visitors back in the 70s. But there was (and is) such a glut of hotels in the area that rates have long been depressed, so Ramada apparently just let the place go to pot rather than sink money into keeping it up. And now it's handed off. Avoid. And beware of bidding through Priceline. This was a textbook example of how their system is NOT supposed to work, and until they start cracking down they deserve to share in all the bad word-of-mouth that places like this will get them.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from this Dump!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: ibuypuntagorda
Reviews.Content: I kept reminding myself, you get what you pay for. This place is the exception, at $70 a night for the upgraded kid suite, it is a bigger rip-off then a nigerian check scam! I would'nt stay here again for free. This was a last minute trip we planned with the kids since it was a long weekend for them. because of the food and wine festival and all the holloween events, all of our usual places were booked. The only rooms we could find kicked off at about $125 a night and the other party in our group did not want to pay over $100, so we figured how bad could a Ramada be? Lets start at the parking lot, we arrived at about 10pm. no parking out front, so we parked out back. This is the darkest parking lot I have seen at any hotel. Then you have all the undesirables "hanging out" drinking and blasting their stereo's. Where is security? Every night of our stay I would drop the family off at the lobby and would brave the parking. The hallways are dirty and musty. The room smelled nasty. I always carry lysol with us when we travel, but I needed to buy another bottle for this place. The beds only had flat sheets, so in the morning you wake up lying on a bare dirty matress. The bathroom had mold on the ceilings, the paint was coming of the tub, and the toilet tank had a broken lid. I woke up in the morning to find roaches on my left over pizza. The elevators are flaky, we had to used the stairs a couple of times(4th floor). The pool looked like it had not been brushed in months. I have stayed in close to 80 hotels all over the world, I would rate this in the top 5 dumps I have seen. So, why didnt I leave the first night you ask? My inlaws/ babysitters in the next room refused to switch. Ramada - Shame on you! take your name off that dump before you lose more customers.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel in Kissimmee”
Reviews.Author: pancho11
Reviews.Content: I rencetly stayed at this so called "Ramada Inn" after getting this through priceline. I was amazed how bad this hotel was.First, the condition of the hotel was extremely aweful,rooms dirty,carpeting stained, and beds and linenes and pillows worned and dirty. Two,the quality of the guests were extremely poor,they have hookers,yes,hookers living in the hotel,soliciting guests and as well as bringing customers to the room!!The hookers are extremely grotesque looking and I noticed them smoking what appeaered like Crack, in the pool area!Third, they also have long term construction people living there, who are young men, drunk in the hallways,staring at all the women and also having street hookers coming to there rooms. I mentioned this to the administration of the hotel, but they did'nt care, and they stated "Unless we catch them doing something we can't do a thing"!Fourth, the pool area is dirty, there is no restuarant,no wear to get a drink and also the construction guys sit by the pool,screaming and drinking beer all dat as well as oggling all the women, from age 12 to 88!!These guys are also smoking marijuana in the pool area as well as in the halls, making this hotel smell and or reek like POT! Also the pool area does not have security guard or a lifeguard,or even a camera, and while I was staying there, a young tourist girl,12, died in the pool area. My suggestion is to have the county officials who approved the owners to allow this place to run as a hotel,to investigate if the owner paid them off,because no way can a place like this be open and be run like a hotel!!This place needs to be closed down by the county!!!

Reviews.Title: “Can you say Nasty?”
Reviews.Author: kattimNc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on a group trip. One group had to change rooms because the door on the balcony fell off. Another group had to change rooms because there were toe nails, yes I said "toe nails" in the bed. After getting to the new room, the floor was dirty. My room... the bath tub looked dirty, and there was mold on the shower curtain. I guess it was a good thing we were only in the room to sleep. Also, there were no mini refrig's or microwaves in our rooms as stated. The ice machine on our floor did not work. The only good thing at this hotel was the breakfast in the Coney Island Restauant and the fact that there is a small store in it. I will NOT stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not Very Good”
Reviews.Author: LawNOrderGuy
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs a lot of work, and people who book here should beware of "nickel-and diming". For example, they charge you $3.34 per day a "resort fee" that other 192 hotels seem to find a way not to charge. They explain that it's for use of their recreational equipment, their in-room safe, and shuttle to Disney. If you do not use those services, TOUGH. If they're so desperate for the $2.95 plus tax, they should just raise their room rates by 3-dollars so people don't know they're being ripped. I mean, I've stayed at budget hotels like Days Inn and Super 8 and actually been reimbursed a $1 safe fee. And beware if you use their shuttle to anywhere but Disney. The shuttle to Sea World, for example, will cost you even though you already "paid for it in the resort fee". Another thing: local calls are NOT free and they charge you after so many minutes....there's no free continental breakfast. These are all little things that even a budget hotel provides. Internet will cost you $1 per 20 minutes on a lobby kiosk, although you can sit on a couch with your laptop next to the kiosk and get free Net. The Net does not work in the rooms. The TV has only a few channels above the ABC, CBS, etc. I know being on vacation isn't about watching TV, but if the Super 8 down the street can have 60 cable channels, why can't a supposedly-superior Ramada? So, you can save a few bucks by choosing this hotel but you end up paying more, or the same as another 192 hotel that offers these perks. The hallways smelled very bad on the fourth floor, where my room was. Like cat urine. But I will say the rooms themselves were fine, beds were comfortable....and the hotel's location on 192 is very good for getting to attractions. But, honestly people, even if you use priceline and get this hotel for 35-40 a night, it still isn't an upgrade....plenty of hotels on 192 that cost a bit more, and even some below that price, that are better.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and location”
Reviews.Author: Skymatron
Reviews.Content: Used this hotel as a base for a 2 week stay in Kissimmee. Nice big rooms, not luxurious but perfectly comfortable with plenty of storage space. Liked having a large fridge and microwave in the room. Staff were always helpful and the one small problem we had with the hairdrier was fixed instantly. Location was perfect to explore all the attractions. Large car park on site. Excellent pool. Hotel does need some updating but in general was ideal for our needs, afterall at this location you only need a hotel to sleep and shower as you are out and about all day! In summary good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “US 192, Kissimmee, FL sad, sad”
Reviews.Author: Poo1
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Ramada on 02/23/07. My husband was treated with a business/pleasant desk person. Given our room # and keys we began our journey. Entering the room we turned down our bed covers as all folks do when inspecting their room they will be staying & sleeping in for the next day or so. We discovered hairs in the bed and on the pillows of both beds. We also found lots of hair in the bath tub, along with mold on the ceiling. The shower curtain on the outside was in poor shape and the toilet seat was in bad condition. We had our cat with us and on the one day we were away for the entire day and came back, he had done his usual safari hunt only to drag out and greet us with a strange looking dead & dried up creature. We were afraid to sleep in this room because of mold, dirty linen, poor conditions in the bath room and the carpet was an entire other subject that needed replaced or at the very least professionally cleaned. Adding injury to insult the day we departed the lady at the desk was on the phone, printed our bill for me to sign and never even said thank you. We felt violated, our money was good but the Ramada does not live up to practicing good, clean normal standards. We have traveled a lot in our 31 years and this was by far the worst place we have ever stayed but we were pressed for time and needed a place to stay. It was a sad sight and we won't use them again.

Reviews.Title: “Find someplace else to stay at”
Reviews.Author: dcunning30
Reviews.Content: My wife and I got a package to stay at this Ramada for free once we attend a timeshare marketing event. We checked into the hotel and it was so bad, we went across the street to the Best Western and paid out of pocket to stay there. The Best Western was excellent. Here's our experience. Once we checked in, we noticed the walls were scuffed. This was not a deal breaker. As we walked to our room, there was a man openly swigging on a bottle of liquor next to us and another creepy looking man that gave us serious pause. Once we got to our room, we noticed the following: stained carpet stained mattresses rusted door hinges in the bathroom frayed bed-spread wallpaper torn off in the bathroom mold where the wallpaper was torn off toilet-paper holder was barely attached to the wall bathroom mirror had discolored edges As I stated previously, my wife could not stay there, so we went to the Best Western across the street. Prior to leaving, we drove around the parking lot and we noticed around the side, someone was reparing their car, and another person had parked his van up to the room and was openly consuming alcohol and playing loud music.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: The Walt Disney World in my mind
Reviews.Title: “What a dump!”
Reviews.Author: Figment73
Reviews.Content: We were made to stay in this hotel after purchasing a time share presentation trip. We stayed here after our week long Disney trip and knew it'd be a step down but, didn't realize it would actually be a plummet down! Let me preface this by saying the staff were very friendly but, be aware that when you are walking through the lobby to get to the elevator you will be accosted by some bitter old lady in the discount ticket booth trying to hawk her wares on you and making you feel like a loser if you don't buy her cheap tickets. Walking down the hallway to the room should of given us a clue as the wall coverings were bubbling out and starting to peel at the top. The hall carpeting was very dingy and bubbling as well. When we got in to our room we noticed the wall coverings were doing the same. The tank lid on the toilet was broken and left a big opening on the top. Dingy and nasty looking bath tub full of rust stains. I saw a bug, not sure if it was a palmetto or roach, in the bathroom. Dark stains on the side of the box spring mattress. And something yucky was on the wall (Looked like someone snotty boogers). I realize now that these timeshare people put you up in a crappy hotel to make their condos look like golden dreams, it didn't work on us but, it probably does on lots of people. The only good of this place was it had a nice pool but, most places do in Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Would we return 6 times if it were bad?!?!?!?!?”
Reviews.Author: Rob&Caralyn
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October 1999/2000/2002/2004 and May/June 2005 & 2006. WOULD WE RETURN IF THIS HOTEL WAS SO BAD?? We are a family of 4, (in '06 we were 2 adults, 1 x 20 & 1 x 15) have 1 room, have THE most amazing time EVERY time we visit Orlando and have NO faults with this hotel...............It's easy to get everywhere, including Walmart....(great place!!!!) We DON'T have low standards, in fact, I am told I am v critical and have v high expectations so take from this what you will... We ARE returning in Dec 2007..................

Reviews.Title: “Thank god it was only for one night”
Reviews.Author: josiej
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel about three times in the past but the last time was about four years ago. A lot can change in such a short time. We had booked to stay for one night on arrival to orlando so that we could recharge our batteries before driving down to miami. I was surprised to see how run down, dirty and smelly the hotel had become, it is crying out to be refurbished. The room we had was quite big with two double beds, but it had a very strange musty smell. The carpet was old and dirty and the air conditioning unit was noisy and full of grime and dust. The coffee maker did not work, but they did bring another one to the room when asked. I am sad to say I would not stay here again unless it is refurbished, which is a shame because it used to be a lovely hotel and is in a great location for the disney parks. I just thank god that I was not staying here for more than one night.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for !!!”
Reviews.Author: Oceanguy
Reviews.Content: I like staying on 192 and there are a lot of motels and hotels to pick from from cheap to expensive. I usually stay at the buget as long as they are clean and although sometimes fooled and vacating immediately, I know what to expect for the money. The Ramada is your basic budget motel and for the most part, clean. The biggest concern for me is making sure there is fresh linen on the beds and the bathroom is clean. This was the case at this motel so I stayed for the week at a rate of $235.00 plus tax. Be warned, their is tax and surcharges so after all is added, it's closer to $300.00 but still a fair value at $42.00 per night. Maintenance here is fair, I called for 2 clogged sinks and needed some drain opener, a man arrived and fiddled with the trap but couldn't fix either of them, I told him they needed draino and he looked at me as if I had 2 heads. Fire alarms went off at different times through the 7 day stay and we lost hot water one morning. Peeling tub paint and a leaking toilet but again, what do I expect for $35.00 + per night ?? It was clean. So in ending, I stayed for an additional 7 nights and put up again with the minor problems. Housekeeping was very considerate to obeying our DND and cleaned our room every afternoon without fail. Our pillows were typical flat motel pillows that were replaced with what appeared to be new fluffy pillows without our request, a nice touch. I would return to this motel if the price is right and their pool and hot tub all seem nice, but were not used by us or even any other guest during our stay. Did not try the restaurant on premises, went to Perkins and I-hop most of the time.

Reviews.Title: “Hotell needs upgrade, Ramada name let down”
Reviews.Author: cookiebang
Reviews.Content: We stayed there due to a package we booksx online that included car rental and airplane. When we got there, noticed the lobby was small. The Ramada name used to be somewhat good but now its even worse than Holiday Inn or Best Western. Room was a decent size (2 double beds but for only 2 pple) but iit smelled very old and musty. Especially after room cleaning the cleanning lady would turn off the a/c, and you walk in after a whole day out you can definately smell how old the hotel is. THe carpet was dirty with stains even when the color is dark green. The bathtub was so small and rusty around the stainless steel. The water that came out smelled disgusting. At first I thought it was the curtain but figured later it was actually the water because the tap water was the same. The toilet paper was very rough, it would actually hurt you rather than help you. There was no conditioner available at the hotel even when asked. The cleaning lady was cheap, for a 4 person room she gave one 15ml bottle of shampoo! Had to request more at front desk. Each morning at 7:30 am the bar would blare music. Not all rooms have internet (wireless), only 10 rooms on first floor at hallway nearest to lobby. A hassle to go to lobby all the time to access internet. There is also a surcharge of 2.95+tax each day per room. There is a free shuttle to go to Disney but not many pple use it. We used it 2 times and the bus driver is always late to pick us up. Parking was available, close to restaurants, highway, shopping. Lots of other competitive hotels nearby. Would not stay here again. Definately needs renovation.

Reviews.Title: “Orlando, Florida”
Reviews.Author: mikeg001
Reviews.Content: Hotel needs upgrading, beds very low to the ground, tv did not work well people running up and down the halls all hours of the night and into the morning. This is a very low budget hotel not what I was expecting from a chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Filthy and disgusting!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed there because we couldn't find anything else on last Friday Night at 11 pm. It was the most horrible experience I had. My husband and I woke up itching allover. My husband had a rash in his face the next morning. The bedsheets were nasty. They charged us $79 for which in my opinion was a DUMP. I would never recommend this hotel to anybody. I rather sleep in my car the next time.

Reviews.Title: “Overall enjoyed our stay...”
Reviews.Author: MiMiCindy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nites with our 2 granddaughters as a timeshare tour trip. The outside is nice, lots of plants, adequate parking with short walk to front door. Small but clean and very cute lobby. The desk clerk was nice as was all of the ones we encountered. First nite we stayed in the standard room--the toilet ran all nite and the next day and was difficult to get to flush. You had to work with it (something I dont want to do on vacation). The room was clean and the little balcony nice (esp for my husband to go out and smoke and not get the room all smelly). 2nd day we upgraded to the kid room. This was after we were told 2 different upgrade prices by 2 different clerks but was charged for the lower price. Was well worth it. This room had a little privacy wall between us and the kids. They had bunk beds with cartoon character bedding and their own TV. This bathroom much better esp as far as the toilet! The room was clean, quiet and the curtain pulled and made it very dark so we slept really well. Only problem was the AC unit leaked and left the carpet soaked in one area. Easy access to ice machines and elevators. We didnt eat at the restaurant there due to the high prices. Oh and we had microwave and frig in our room (both of them). The pool was nice and clean. Water temp just right and they furnished towels. The jacuzzi would have been much more enjoyable had the temp of the water been higher, it was barely warm. Plenty of chairs and tables at the pool. Had 2 TVs in the room which was great for us as I didnt have to watch cartoons for 3 days, however, we did compete with the kids with the TV volume as there is not much separation there. I mean, there was a few probs, but nothing so severe that I wouldnt recommend it. It is beside a small lake and that provided a fairly nice view. I would definitely recommend this place and it is worth the upgrade if you travel with children.

Reviews.Title: “3 Nights, 3 Different rooms!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cheeks605
Reviews.Content: Terrible! We had a huge spider in our first room that lived in a web taking up an entire corner - probably not cleaned in weeks! I was affraid the spider was actually a blessing, msybe it was eating the other bugs in the room. The sink had two temperature options - scolding or freezing. Our second room needed paint, and lamps that worked. I wanted to take a shower wearing flip flops, I opened the shower curtain and there was hair all over the shower wall. On to the third room - a newly renovated room. Nice paint, the bathroom still required flip flops. The stained housekeeping envelope should have been my first indication to get out quick! This hotel should charge $20 a night - though even that would be too much!

Reviews.Title: “great Base for Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: when I read the reviews on this site I was worried about the hotel. To clear a few things up it is a cheap 3 star hotel that is close to Disney. It offers a pool, bar, restuarant and is a basic hotel. To be honest you are getting what you pay for but it was a good base, the staff where friendly and it was clean but could have done with being updated and decorated but you get what you pay for. If you are coming to Florida to laze about a pool all day and drink cocktails its not the hotel for you but if you are coming and want to get out and about every day, go to Disney or shopping then it is perfect. I asked at reception for a newly renovated room and they were more than happy to oblige. I would take a lot of reviews with a pinch of salt and as long as you dont want 4/5 star luxury then this hotel is perfect. I would go back again if I was going for a similar type of holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Check in and Check Out!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The place is a dump! We check in and check right back out the only thing I think we didn't get hasled on is are money back when we said we could not stay there. Let me tell you I read the reivews some good and some bad but if your use to staying in a nice room I mean clean some updates this is not the place for you. Like I read in the reviews paint pelling of the walls dirt walls sinks that leak. This hotel is on its last leg. About the only thing nice about this place is the lobby but your not staying there. Good luck hope this helps. FYI if your looking for a nice place with a pretty decent price try the Holliday in main gate we stayed there and they treated us right!!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a package deal. The housekeeping did leave a lot to be desired. Upon arriving, we were checked into a standard room that reeked. I mean REEKED. My four year old daughter said "It smells like pee in here." We complained at the front desk and he immediately issued us another room. This room was much nicer and cleaner, except the bed had no linens on it! We again talked to the night manager who said they would take care of it right away. We left for dinner and when we came back, the new linens were folded, sitting on the bed. So we had to make the bed ourselves. The bathrooms were moldy, the toilet ran, the faucets were faulty, and the hallway carpets were disguisting. However, the pool was nice, the staff were fairly friendly, the arcade was fun. If you want cheap, stay here. If you want clean, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Pass on this one...”
Reviews.Author: dmp828
Reviews.Content: I figured that I would take a chance on this one because there were a few favorable reviews, but I would never recommend this to anyone. Keeping in mind that it was more of a budget hotel, I didn't expect anything much. Maybe just a basic room. We didn't even get that. We looked at two separate rooms and they had a very unpleasant odor, peeling paint, the toilet seat was up, all the lights were on, the bed linens were slightly tossled as if someone had been in there, there were black marks on the walls, the furniture was chipped, etc. We ended up leaving and having to stay at another hotel. If you are even considering it, please do yourself a favor and reconsider.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we opened the door to our room it smelled of a pungent cleansing odor. The paint was peeling off the wall in one corner, there was mold in the bathroom shower. There were spots on sheets and blankets and they looked and felt about twenty years old. One of the beds had springs coming through and they did replace it when I requested from the manager. There was garbage behind the beds not cleaned. We were there four nights and one night the fire alarms went off and when I asked other people in the hallway what was going on, no one knew. The hallway doors had shut and my daughter was pretty scared. Not one phone or employee informed us of why the alarms went off. Overall this hotel smelled bad and the carpet was filthy. This hotel should be shutdown until they can get it back up to code. I'll never stay in a Ramada again.

Reviews.Title: “Forget About Housekeeping!”
Reviews.Author: MBM45
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I just returned 1/30/06 from a 5 day stay at the Ramada Inn Resort Eastgate. All prior reviews about the hotel pool is accurate. Nice pool. Front check is nice too. The rest of the hotel leaves alot to be desired. The hallways smell musty, the stairwell smells like someone used it for a bathroom. We were in room 5219. Badly needing of painting and dirty. The bathroom ceiling leaks when the water is turned on and you would think when you took your shower that the ceiling was going to give way. The housekeeping staff did not give us any soap, shampoo, coffee or sugar packets every day. The second day the front desk had to bring us these items. Each day following that, I would have to sneek into the housekeeping room to obtain these items. Tub was not cleaned, as there was the prior guests soap wrapper in the tub when we checked in. Paint is chipping everywhere and badly. We knew we were not paying for a 5 star hotel, however, we thought that since it was a Ramada Inn it would be fine for what we wanted: clean room, clean sheets. Basic essentials for place to sleep and shower. This however was not the case. Stay away from the restuarant. Tried to get a cup of coffee one night and three servers came up and said someone would be with me in a minute. 15 minutes later, no server, no coffee. There were only 2 tables with customers in the restuarant. Did check out the buffet, and I would never pay to eat there. Advice: Stay somewhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Not What We Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel which was a package deal. The first room we got had an overwhelming, musty bleach smell. We changed rooms...b/c the smell was burning our nose. The second room smelled better but the floors & walls were filthy. The base of the bed the matress lays on was filthy. The bathroom ceiling was peeling, the shower stahl was recently painted & that was peeling all over. The walls were DIRTY..& needed a paint job!! The a/c had a major rattle. The hallway carpet was filthy & all the hallways had a musty, dirty, stinky smell! We were there for 7 days & hardly anyone every ate at the CONEY ISLAND in the lobby. They had a gift shop in the lobby that was so over priced it was shameful. The swimming pool looked clean & it was peanut shaped-(very nice pool) . They had a small game room & the fitness room was a joke! I dont think anyone in the hotel spoke English. There were foreign people everywhere. The TV & Pool were really the only good thing about the place. The elevators were crusty & old... our room was on the 3rd floor & one time the elevators didnt even work to come down to the lobby..we had to take the stairs! Whoever owns this Hotel is letting it go to the DOGS! ill never stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Please change the linens between guests!”
Reviews.Author: JanetPRN
Reviews.Content: I arrived on a Sunday evening and went to bed. In the morning I discovered dirty childrens socks in the bed with me (I was not travelling with children) along with crumbs and fruit punch stains on the sheets and jam on the other beds cover. I called the day manager who was not helpful at all. I told them I wanted fresh clean linen. I stripped the beds & put the linens on the floor. Imagine my horror when I came back Monday night and found the same sheets were put back on the bed!!(the punch stains were proof). I went to the night mgr and complained again. He offered to send someone up to change the bedding. A security guard came up with 4 flat sheets and handed them to me. When I complained in the morning, the same mgr Kevin was on . Again he made no effort at service recovery, only stated that it's their policy to change linens every other day. HOW ABOUT B/W GUESTS!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again Not Even For Free!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i knew that i could not expect a great hotel but this one was very awful. i had to go to bed with wet hair because the hair dryer was broken, i took cold showers because there was not hot water, the rooms were dirty and smelled, the carpet was diry everywhere. there are no words to explain how disgusted i was. the staff is nice but this can't make up for the rest. people don't ruin your vacation avoid to stay at this hotel. you wont regret it!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel and restaurant are great, but beware the "helpful" Disney people”
Reviews.Author: JBro
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself was great. It was your typical Ramada stay -- clean, with up-to-date accomodations, and the staff was very helpful. They even bent the rules and let us check in early after our 20 hour drive from Pennsylvania. Gotta love that! The restaurant was all right. We ate our breakfast there because the buffet really wasn't bad and for a family of four to eat for a whopping $12 or so is pretty amazing (kids eat free). The staff there was very helpful and friendly, more so than the folks working the Disney counter. And therein lies the problem... If we had any questions about Disney, the front desk staff referred us to the "wonderful" Disney counter next to them. To say the folks working there were clueless is an understatement. We received more helpful information about the various parks from the staff at the restaurant. That, coupled with -- as one other person had said -- the lack of transportation to and from the park -- were the only downers. The shuttle is a bust. There's only a 9:30 AM hotel pick up time and 6 PM, 7PM, and 10:30 PM park pick ups. We have a seven year old and a five year old and had hoped to do one of the parks in the AM, take a break and head back to the room to give the kids some down time in the afternoon and then return in the evening. Nope. Couldn't do it unless we drove. We also couldn't do the waterparks unless we drove because the shuttle didn't go to Typhoon Lagoon or Blizzard Beach -- this was something NOT mentioned in our travel arrangements, because if it had been, we might've reconsidered our stay. There's got to be another shuttle service that the hotel can contract with. If they would, then this would've been the idea off-property Disney stay.

HotelInfo.Name: America's Best Inn Main Gate East
HotelInfo.Address: 5150 West US Hwy 192, Kissimmee, FL 34746
